post_content: Adir A is a blend that teaches us year after year about the quality and professionalism of the winery. Every year, it is consistently excellent. This year, too, it is especially pampering, rich, full, and velvety. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2016 ABV: 14.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Shiraz, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc Intensity (1-5): 4 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: Harav Mordecai Unger - Monsey, Badatz Beit Yosef, Rabanut Marom Hagalil * Embark on a flavorful journey. Every wine we offer is tasted by us first, guaranteeing quality and value. High intensity (4 of 5) - High-intensity wines are bold and expressive, with pronounced aromas and concentrated flavors. They deliver a more impactful wine experience. These wines stand up well to richer, more flavorful foods, often cutting through richness or complementing strong spices. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

The experience remains relatively simple but with a touch more depth than the very basic wines. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. post_content: Jezreel Pet Nat Rosé - Pet Nat is the friendly name for pétillant naturel, which is French for naturally sparkling. In very short - The wine is capped before it finishes its initial fermentation, keeping the C02 as part of the party. It is a growing trend in the winemaking world and also as part of the movement towards natural wine. This one made by Jezreel (who are among the pioneers of this in Israel) is super fruity, fun and fresh. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2018 ABV: 11.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Carignan Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 3 Kashrut: OK-P * Your satisfaction, bottled. We sample all our wines prior to ordering, guaranteeing a selection of quality and value. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/JezreelPetNatRose20191000.png ! alt : Jezreel Pet Nat Rose ! title : Jezreel Pet Nat Rose ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Jezreel Pet Nat Rose is super fruity, fun and fresh. It is capped before it finishes its initial fermentation, keeping the C02 as part of the party.

post_content: Lahat Laichter is a unique blend of Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Marsanne. This wine is concentrated, refreshing and aromatic in a special way. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 13.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Roussanne, Grenache Blanc, Marsanne Complexity (1-5): 5 Acidity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: sweet flavors * Embark on a flavorful journey. Every wine we offer is tasted by us first, guaranteeing quality and value. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.

post_content: Yaacov Oryah Light from Darkness is a "Blanc de Noir", a white wine made from red grapes. The color of the wine is light and even slightly greenish. The wine has a fresh taste full of herbal flavors and fruit flavors, with balanced acidity and citrus aroma. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2022 ABV: 10.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Grenache, Cinsault, Mourvedre, Barbera Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich or intense flavors Kashrut: Rabanut Mateh Yehuda Heter Mechira * Sip assuredly. We personally taste each wine before it's offered, ensuring both quality and excellent value for you. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.

post_title: Yaacov Oryah Alpha Omega Chenin Blanc
post_content: Yaacov Oryah Alpha Omega Chenin Blanc is a wine that is made using a special method. This white wine was fermented with the skins of the grapes and so it has a deep color (hence the name orange wine) and intense flavors not usually found in white wines. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2022 ABV: 12.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Chenin Blanc Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors * Your satisfaction, bottled. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. High acidity (4 of 5) - Expect a bright, tangy quality that makes feels fresh and lively. Acidity adds tartness, giving the wine a clean feel. With food, this crisp and zingy character can beautifully cut through richness and make flavors pop. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_content: Dalton Petite Sirah is an excellent expression of the depth of this variety. It is rich in flavors and full of vitality without being too heavy or busy. There is a wealth of fruit and dark chocolate flavors here, and a great finish. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 13.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Coastal Plain Grape(s): Petite Sirah Intensity (1-5): 3 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: Rabanut Marom Hagalil Heter Mechira * Discover your perfect pour. Quality and value are our promise, achieved through our personal tasting of every wine before we offer it. Moderate intensity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate intensity showcase a balanced expression of aromas and flavors. They offer a satisfying presence on the palate without being heavy. These wines are versatile with food, capable of complementing a range of dishes without overpowering more delicate elements or being lost with richer ones. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_content: Chevel Yehuda Nachshon Reserve is a special blend, created from three classic grape varieties, all grown in Vineyards in the Samarian Mountains. This blend has incredibly deep but smooth flavors. Its lush and dark fruit aromas combined with a long finish, would easily compliment gourmet cuisine and aged cheese. Dry Red Wine ABV: 14.5% Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Merlot Intensity (1-5): 4 Complexity (1-5): 5 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: Badatz Eida Haredit Yerushalaim * Experience wine, worry-free. We taste each selection to ensure you always receive wines of great quality and value. High intensity (4 of 5) - High-intensity wines are bold and expressive, with pronounced aromas and concentrated flavors. They deliver a more impactful wine experience. These wines stand up well to richer, more flavorful foods, often cutting through richness or complementing strong spices. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_content: Nana Tethys is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon. It is a rich, deep wine with a pampering texture and a variety of fruit flavors accompanied by rich spiciness. It also has a great, concentrated finish. This is a perfect wine for a cool and fresh evening. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 14.4% Volume: 750 ML Region: Negev Grape(s): Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Petite Sirah Intensity (1-5): 4 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Marom Hagalil * Delight in every glass. Our commitment to quality and value means we taste every wine before it makes its way to you. High intensity (4 of 5) - High-intensity wines are bold and expressive, with pronounced aromas and concentrated flavors. They deliver a more impactful wine experience. These wines stand up well to richer, more flavorful foods, often cutting through richness or complementing strong spices. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.
post_excerpt: Rich and deep with a variety of fruit flavors accompanied by rich spiciness.

post_content: Vitkin Pinot Noir is a remarkable Pinot Noir with a wonderful aroma and a large range of flavors varying between crispy minerality to a soft but dominant presence of fresh fruit. The combination between these unique flavors creates a Pinot noir wine that is hard to resist. Despite its youth, this Pinot Noir by Vitkin has managed to accumulate a enthusiastic crowed and it is no surprise! due to the careful tracing throughout the ripening season and the calculated date of harvest. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2019 ABV: 13.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Pinot Noir Intensity (1-5): 2 Complexity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Badatz Haredim - P - Not Mevushal - HaRav A.A. Katz, Rabanut Emek Hefer * Explore and discover wines with confidence. We taste before ordering, to offer only wines of quality and value. Low intensity (2 of 5) - Low-intensity wines offer a more noticeable but still gentle character. Flavors and aromas are present but not overpowering. They provide a lighter wine experience, suitable for lighter dishes where the wine acts as a gentle accompaniment, neither dominating nor disappearing. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses.

post_content: Recanati Gris de Marselan is an exceptional rosé, and has been for several years. The wine is particularly aromatic, with delicate aromas of flowers and red fruit. The taste is particularly elegant and delicate. The winemaker - Kobi Arbiv enjoys fermenting the grapes in a unique method in order to preserve its aromaticity as much as possible. The result before us is undoubtedly a success of the method. post_content: Kishor Mourvedre is a unique wine. Its taste is subtle but the impression it leaves is very deep. It has a character that combines earthiness and red fruit together in a fascinating combination. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 13.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Mourvedre Intensity (1-5): 2 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich or sweet flavors Kashrut: Badatz Beit Yosef * Experience wine, worry-free. We taste each selection to ensure you always receive wines of great quality and value. Low intensity (2 of 5) - Low-intensity wines offer a more noticeable but still gentle character. Flavors and aromas are present but not overpowering. They provide a lighter wine experience, suitable for lighter dishes where the wine acts as a gentle accompaniment, neither dominating nor disappearing. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Kishor-Mourvedre-NV-1000.png ! alt : Kishor Mourvedre ! title : Kishor Mourvedre ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Kishor Mourvedre combines earthiness and red fruit together in a fascinating combination., leaving a deep impression.

post_content: Backoushe The Carpenter is unique both in terms of its grape composition and in terms of the combination of 2020 and 2021 vintages. The wine has very rich aromas led by the fruit and with a pleasant envelope of spices. Its taste continues the experience and is rich in spicy fruit flavors with a small touch of tobacco. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_content: Ghito Shani is a fascinating combination of Carignan and Syrah that on the one hand expresses the uniqueness of the grape varieties, and on the other hand demonstrates to us how the harmony between them gives us a result that is greater than the sum of its parts. Ghito Shani will go well with interesting and flavorful meals. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2016 ABV: 14.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee, Judean Hills, Coastal Plain Grape(s): Carignan, Syrah Intensity (1-5): 3 Complexity (1-5): 5 Harmonize with: rich flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Recommended decanting - 30 minutes Kashrut: Star-K-P, Rabanut Hod Hasharon - Pesah * Quality and value, guaranteed. Before we order wines, we personally taste them to be sure you get the best selection. Moderate intensity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate intensity showcase a balanced expression of aromas and flavors. They offer a satisfying presence on the palate without being heavy. These wines are versatile with food, capable of complementing a range of dishes without overpowering more delicate elements or being lost with richer ones. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Ghito-Shani-NV-1000.png ! alt : Ghito Shani ! title : Ghito Shani ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Gito Shani is a Carignan and Syrah combination that uses the unique varietal tastes to harmonize into a result greater than the sum of its parts.

post_content: Netofa Ruby is a port-style dessert wine that expresses the special combination of Touriga Nacional and the Tempranillo. Aged for two years in old barrels, the wine expresses rich fruit and balanced flavors with a dominant sweetness for an exceptional fortified dessert wine experience. Netofa Ruby is an excellent wine to accompany a winter meal or to give an interesting contrast to salty cheeses. post_title: Teperberg Dani Friedenberg Ramato of Pinot Gris
post_content: Teperberg Dani Friedenberg Ramato of Pinot Gris is an exceptional wine. The word Ramato means copper in Italian. The Pinot Gris skins are allowed to remain for part of the fermentation, giving the wine a distinctive coppery color. Although it is a white grape, the Pinot Gris skins add pink color, and the result is a wine with a surprisingly light reddish hue. Scents of citrus and raspberry accompany balanced mineral flavors. There is also a slight and healthy yeast bitterness. It is recommended to chill this wine slightly before drinking. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 13.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Pinot Gris Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 2 Harmonize with: intense flavors Contrast with: mild or sweet flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Mateh Yehuda * Discover your perfect pour. Quality and value are our promise, achieved through our personal tasting of every wine before we offer it. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Scents of citrus and raspberry accompany balanced mineral flavors.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Teperberg-Ramato-of-Pinot-Gris-NV-1000.png ! alt : Teperberg Ramato of Pinot Gris NV ! title : Teperberg Ramato of Pinot Gris NV ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Teperberg Ramato of Pinot Gris is an exceptional wine. The skins remain during fermentation, giving the Ramato (Italian for 'copper') light red color.

post_content: Teperberg Dani Friedenberg Grenache is a wine whose innovation is evident at every stage of its preparation, from the special treatment in the vineyard to fermentation in open tanks. The result is also fascinating. Fresh flavors lead the tasting with the presence of delicate fruit and the smell of raspberries and cranberries. This is a young and curious "Mediterranean" wine, and a great opening move. It is recommended to cool slightly before drinking. post_content: Ben Ami Emek Hazor Rosé is a deep and impressive Rosé. The delicate work of winemaker Jacob Ben Ami gives us a sharp and mineral rosé with a surprising variety of flavors. Rosé Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 13.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Pinot Noir, Syrah, Merlot Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: rich flavors Contrast with: mild, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: Rabanut Ma'ale Efrayim * Discover your perfect pour. Quality and value are our promise, achieved through our personal tasting of every wine before we offer it. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Sharp and mineral with a surprising variety of flavors.

post_title: Galil Mountain Yiftah Vineyard Petit Verdot
post_content: Galil Mountain Yiftah Vineyard Petit Verdot is powerful with many layers of flavors, yet gentle and ready to drink. Galil Yiftah Vineyard is showing a new facet with this 2018 vintage Petit Verdot. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2018 ABV: 15.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee, Golan Heights Grape(s): Petit Verdot Intensity (1-5): 5 Complexity (1-5): 5 Harmonize with: intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Recommended decanting - 45 minutes Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Tiveria * Experience wine, worry-free. We taste each selection to ensure you always receive wines of great quality and value. Very High intensity (5 of 5) - Powerful and concentrated wine, boasting intense aromas and a rich, often complex palate. The wine experience is significant and commanding. They pair best with equally intense and flavorful dishes that can match their strength and complexity. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. post_content: Yaacov Oryah The Silent Hunter is a fascinating wine created to demonstrate the ability of the Semillon to age for years. The Chenin Blanc was incorporated to make the Semillon more accessible. It has high acidity and minerality and wonderful freshness. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2020 ABV: 11.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Negev Grape(s): Semillon, Chenin Blanc Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 5 Contrast with: rich, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Lachish * Quality and value, guaranteed. Before we order wines, we personally taste them to be sure you get the best selection. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Very high acidity (5 of 5) - Expect noticeable tartness and freshness, often described as zesty or crisp. This lively quality can make the wine feel vibrant and mouthwatering. When it comes to food, the acidity in wine acts like a squeeze of lemon, cutting through richness, balancing fats, and enhancing flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Complex aromas and tastes of citrus, tree fruits, and earthy minerality with intense acidity.

post_content: Pinto Shiraz is a deep ruby-purple color with an elegant combination of tastes, tannins, and acidity with a long finish. Scents of dark berries, cranberries, and pepper with hints of smoked meat, spices and dark chocolate. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 14.6% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills, Negev Grape(s): Shiraz Intensity (1-5): 3 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Lachish * Your satisfaction, bottled. We sample all our wines prior to ordering, guaranteeing a selection of quality and value. Moderate intensity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate intensity showcase a balanced expression of aromas and flavors. They offer a satisfying presence on the palate without being heavy. These wines are versatile with food, capable of complementing a range of dishes without overpowering more delicate elements or being lost with richer ones. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_title: Yaacov Oryah Alpha Omega Dry Viognier
post_content: Yaacov Oryah Alpha Omega Dry Viognier is a medium-bodied wine with complex layers of taste and feel with sweet and floral scents and an exceptional long and enjoyable experience. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2019 ABV: 12.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Viognier Complexity (1-5): 5 Acidity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich, intense or sweet flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Lachish * Delight in every glass. Our commitment to quality and value means we taste every wine before it makes its way to you. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. High acidity (4 of 5) - Expect a bright, tangy quality that makes feels fresh and lively. Acidity adds tartness, giving the wine a clean feel. With food, this crisp and zingy character can beautifully cut through richness and make flavors pop. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_content: Shiran Triad is a wine that combines depth, minerality and freshness in an impressive way. The combination of the Colombard, Chardonnay, and Riesling gives us a full and sharp wine with a delicate fruitiness. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 12.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills, Golan Heights, Coastal Plain Grape(s): French Colombard, Chardonnay, Riesling Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: rich flavors Contrast with: mild, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: Star-K-P, Rabanut Har Hevron * Experience wine, worry-free. We taste each selection to ensure you always receive wines of great quality and value. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.

High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses.
post_excerpt: Well balanced with some acidity and a medium finish.

We taste before ordering, to offer only wines of quality and value. Low intensity (2 of 5) - Low-intensity wines offer a more noticeable but still gentle character. Flavors and aromas are present but not overpowering. They provide a lighter wine experience, suitable for lighter dishes where the wine acts as a gentle accompaniment, neither dominating nor disappearing. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.

post_content: Mony M White Muscat is an excellent dessert wine. It has tropical aromas and a very pleasant combination of sweetness and fruit flavors. Dessert Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 11.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Muscat of Alexandria Complexity (1-5): 2 Acidity (1-5): 1 Harmonize with: sweet flavors Contrast with: mild or intense flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Badatz Beit Yosef, Badatz Mahzikei Hadat - Belz, Rabanut Mateh Yehuda * Uncork with confidence. We taste each wine before ordering, so your always get wines of quality and value. Low complexity (2 of 5) - Low-complexity wines offer a bit of nuance, perhaps with more discernible aromas or tastes. The experience remains relatively simple but with a touch more depth than the very basic wines. Very low acidity (1 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.
post_excerpt: Tropical aromas and a very pleasant combination of sweetness and fruit flavors.

post_content: Netofa DOR Syrah is the flagship wine of Netofa Winery. Unlike the previous vintages, in the 2018 vintage the Syrah is full-bodied and intense with particularly deep flavors. We taste before ordering, to offer only wines of quality and value. Very High intensity (5 of 5) - Powerful and concentrated wine, boasting intense aromas and a rich, often complex palate. The wine experience is significant and commanding. They pair best with equally intense and flavorful dishes that can match their strength and complexity. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.
post_excerpt: Full-bodied and intense with particularly deep flavors.

post_title: Haroe Orange Wine Chenin Blanc Gewurztraminer

post_content: Yatir Forest - the flagship wine of Yatir Winery has a rich fragrance, and flavors that combines intensity with elegance. Each year the winery selects the plots that gave the best wine and assembles a blend from them. The combination of the different varieties emphasizes their uniqueness, and also the harmony between them. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). post_title: Golan Heights Yarden Yonatan Vineyard Merlot
post_content: Golan Heights Yarden Yonatan Vineyard Merlot is a full-bodied rich wine with notes of blackberry, blueberry and orange blossom, layered with earth, cocoa, tobacco, warm spice and French oak. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2018 ABV: 15.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Merlot Intensity (1-5): 3 Complexity (1-5): 5 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Recommended decanting - 90 minutes Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Tiveria, Rabanut Ramat Hagolan * Uncork with confidence. We taste each wine before ordering, so your always get wines of quality and value. Moderate intensity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate intensity showcase a balanced expression of aromas and flavors. They offer a satisfying presence on the palate without being heavy. These wines are versatile with food, capable of complementing a range of dishes without overpowering more delicate elements or being lost with richer ones. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Yarden-Yonatan-Vineyard-Merlot-nv-1000.png ! alt : Golan Heights Yarden Yonatan Vineyard Merlot ! title : Golan Heights Yarden Yonatan Vineyard Merlot ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Golan Heights Yarden Yonatan Vineyard Merlot is rich with notes of blackberry, blueberry, citrus, earth, cocoa, tobacco, spice and French oak.

post_content: Matar Rosé is fresh, wonderful, and manages to combine great acidity with a rich fruity profile. The blossom and fruit aromas continue straight to the palate with a taste of more and more. Rosé Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 12.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Grenache, Counoise Complexity (1-5): 2 Acidity (1-5): 2 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Ramat Hagolan * Your satisfaction, bottled. We sample all our wines prior to ordering, guaranteeing a selection of quality and value. Low complexity (2 of 5) - Low-complexity wines offer a bit of nuance, perhaps with more discernible aromas or tastes. The experience remains relatively simple but with a touch more depth than the very basic wines. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Floral, fruity, and rich, with balanced acidity.

post_title: Yaacov Oryah Vim and Vigor - Set of 2
post_content: Yaacov Oryah Vim and Vigor - Set of 2 are a pair of fascinating wines that were born as a vision in Simon Jacob's dream and became a reality in the faithful hands of Yaakov Uriah. The pair of wines are similar in their composition, but there is a difference in their taste that illustrates how a delicate touch in wine constitutes a whole world of flavors. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2020 ABV: 11.6% Volume: 750 ML Region: Golan Heights Grape(s): Chardonnay, Semillon, Gewurztraminer Complexity (1-5): 5 Acidity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich flavors Contrast with: intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Lachish * Uncork with confidence. We taste each wine before ordering, so your always get wines of quality and value. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. High acidity (4 of 5) - Expect a bright, tangy quality that makes feels fresh and lively. Acidity adds tartness, giving the wine a clean feel. With food, this crisp and zingy character can beautifully cut through richness and make flavors pop. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.

post_title: Adir Kerem Ben Zimra Grenache Blanc
post_content: Adir Kerem Ben Zimra Grenache Blanc is another unique wine from Adir Winery. It has a delicate aroma, with a floral peach along with a citrus element. The taste is rich and tart with many hints of apricot and melon. post_content:
Negohot Eucalyptus Blossom Honey - Negohot is known for their classic honey production, and this 100% pure premium honey from Eucalyptus blossoms is superb. Unheated to preserve nutritional value and rich taste. This honey is of exceptional quality, with a high nutritional value and a wonderful and deep taste, influenced by the nature of the flowers.

Produced by bees fed no industrial sugar, housed in beehives located adjacent the Eucalyptus groves. Different flowers secrete different nectar, and  the variety of blossoms in nature is also expressed in honey as a variety of tastes, colors, textures and aromas. The bees collect nectar from the abundance of eucalyptus flowers around them, and a characteristic honey with a wonderful and deep taste is the result.

This honey is ideal for sauces, spreads, smoothies, yogurt, granola, cakes, pastries and of course directly from the spoon.

500 grams per jar.

Kosher l'Mehadrin for Passover and year-round under the supervision of Rabbi Moshe Cohen from Har Hebron.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Neghot-Eucalyptus-Honey-1000.png ! alt : Negohot Eucalyptus Blossom Honey ! title : Negohot Eucalyptus Blossom Honey ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: 100% pure premium honey from Eucalyptus blossoms. Unheated to preserve nutritional value and taste. Produced by bees fed no industrial sugar.

post_content: Binyamina Avnei Hahoshen Meirav Vineyard Red Blend has unique flavors of impressive depth. It is a blend of Petit Syrah, Marselan, and Shiraz grapes from the Meirav vineyard in Gilboa. Every wine we offer is tasted by us first, guaranteeing quality and value. Moderate intensity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate intensity showcase a balanced expression of aromas and flavors. They offer a satisfying presence on the palate without being heavy. These wines are versatile with food, capable of complementing a range of dishes without overpowering more delicate elements or being lost with richer ones. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.

post_title: Jerusalem Wineries King’s Cellar Emerald Riesling Muscat
post_content: Jerusalem Wineries King’s Cellar Emerald Riesling Muscat is a fun and sweet wine perfect for any occasion. Its sweetness is pleasant and fresh, and its closure with a champagne cork gives it a festive aspect. Semi Dry Wine ABV: 10.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Emerald Riesling, Muscat Complexity (1-5): 2 Acidity (1-5): 1 Harmonize with: sweet flavors Contrast with: mild, rich or intense flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Rabanut Yerushalayim, Badatz Beit Yosef - Not Mevushal, Badatz Mahzikei Hadat - Belz, Badatz Heichal Lubavitch - Lod * Sip assuredly. We personally taste each wine before it's offered, ensuring both quality and excellent value for you. Low complexity (2 of 5) - Low-complexity wines offer a bit of nuance, perhaps with more discernible aromas or tastes. The experience remains relatively simple but with a touch more depth than the very basic wines. Very low acidity (1 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.

post_content: Shiran Limited Edition Tempranillo is a one-of-a-kind wine. Inspired by Spanish wine, Tempranillo is an old dream of winemaker Eli Sheeran. post_content: Lueria Dry Moscato is a very unique wine. It is very rare to find dry Moscato in Israel. The smell is sweet and seductive, but the wine is dry, sharp and refreshing. The unique taste of Moscato is well expressed, and it is clear that this is not an ordinary wine. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2022 ABV: 11.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Muscat Complexity (1-5): 3 Acidity (1-5): 4 Contrast with: mild, rich or intense flavors Kashrut: Rabanut Marom Hagalil Heter Mechira * Your satisfaction, bottled. We sample all our wines prior to ordering, guaranteeing a selection of quality and value. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. High acidity (4 of 5) - Expect a bright, tangy quality that makes feels fresh and lively. Acidity adds tartness, giving the wine a clean feel. With food, this crisp and zingy character can beautifully cut through richness and make flavors pop. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.
post_excerpt: Sweet, seductive aroma with dry, sharp and refreshing tastes. Heter Mechira

post_content: Memorias Alenar Blanco Tardana is deep, mineral, and unique. The relatively rare Tardana variety ripens late in the season, allowing winegrowers to give it indiviual attention after other grapes are harvested. Hence the name, which indicates the tardiness of the late harvest. post_content: The Vacu Vin Cork Puller is an elegant cork extractor. Corks from older bottles of wine or aging wines may get brittle over time. Using a bottle opener with a wired corkscrew can damage the cork even more, which might result in the bottle not being able to be opened at all. The Cork Puller is the perfect instrument to remove these damaged or brittle corks neatly. After removing the foil or wax from the bottle, gently insert the extended prong between the cork and the bottleneck. While moving downwards, insert the shorter prong until both prongs are fully inserted. A gentle wiggle motion might be needed to help insert the Cork Puller. Once the prongs are secured between the cork and the glass, extract the cork by pulling in a rotating motion. The Cork Puller’s 2-in-1 design allows you to open crown capped bottles such as soft drinks and beer. Its stainless steel handle and non-stick prongs make the Cork Puller a durable product, suitable for prolonged use. The Cork Puller is dishwasher safe and comes with a protective case for safe storage.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Vacu-Vin-Cork-Puller.png ! alt :  ! title : Vacu Vin Cork Puller ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Vacu Vin Cork Puller is the perfect instrument to remove these damaged or brittle corks neatly. Just insert, twist, and remove even the toughest cork.

post_content:
The Vacu Vin Wine Saver has been a household staple since ’86. The Wine Saver creates a vacuum to prevent your opened bottle of wine from oxidizing, making it last up to 10 days. Insert the universal Vacuum Bottle Stopper in your favorite bottle of wine and pump until your hear the patented “Click”. This signals that you have reached the optimum vacuum level, and have created an airtight seal. Your bottle is ready to be stored upright in the fridge, the countertop or a cabinet. The highly durable Wine Saver is made for prolonged use and encourages you to enjoy wine more consciously.
  • Preserves wine up to ten days
  • Included with 2 Vacuum Wine Stoppers
  • The Wine Stoppers are dishwasher friendly
  • The Wine Saver is suitable for all non-sparkling wines
  • The design is highly durable and suitable for prolonged use
  • Made in our production facility in the Netherlands

post_content: The Vacu Vin Active Wine Cooler actively chills your favorite bottle of wine and keeps it cool and refreshing. The insulated bottle cooler sleeve keeps the bottle at its ideal serving temperature until the last sip. For optimal use, keep the reusable sleeve in the freezer for at least 6 hours. The Active Cooler is designed to fit tightly around 0.7-1 L wine and drink bottles. Once used, remove the wine cooler from the wine bottle, flatten it and store the bottle cooler in the freezer. The lightweight, portable cooler is ideal for a picknic, BBQ, beach day, or another outdoor event.

post_content:
Negohot Citrus blossom honey, from the renowned producer of quality honey, is 100% pure honey with wonderful taste and aromas that come from citrus blossoms.

Bees in hives located adjacent citrus groves collect nectar from the flowers and make this wonderful honey. No industrial sugars are fed to the bees, so the honey is 100% pure. The natural variety of blossoms from various trees, each with their own particular nectar, is reflected in the range of tastes and scents of the honey. Hives placed in different locations produce honey that varies in color and flavor, with all of the citrus blossom honey having a light and delicate taste.

Negohot is known for their classic honey production, and this 100% pure premium honey from Eucalyptus blossoms is superb. Unheated to preserve nutritional value and rich taste. This honey is of exceptional quality, with a high nutritional value and a wonderful and deep taste, influenced by the nature of the flowers.

Produced by bees fed no industrial sugar, housed in beehives located adjacent the Eucalyptus groves. Different flowers secrete different nectar, and  the variety of blossoms in nature is also expressed in honey as a variety of tastes, colors, textures and aromas. The bees collect nectar from the abundance of eucalyptus flowers around them, and a characteristic honey with a wonderful and deep taste is the result.

Unheated to preserve the naturally-occurring nutrients, aromas, and flavors, this citrus blossom honey is delicious in cooking and baking, beverages, and when added to granola, yogurt, and many other dishes.

500 grams per jar.

Kosher l'Mehadrin for Passover and year-round under the supervision of Rabbi Moshe Cohen from Har Hebron.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Negohot-Citrus-Blossom-Honey-1000.png ! alt : Negohot Citrus Blossom Honey ! title : Negohot Citrus Blossom Honey ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: 100% pure premium honey from Eucalyptus blossoms. Unheated to preserve nutritional value and taste. Produced by bees fed no industrial sugar.

post_content:
Meshek Achiya Ethiopian Tehina is real, tasty, and high-quality tahina that is the winner in a blind tasting the well-known tahina brands in Israel. The Meshek Achiya Ethiopian Tehina is a clean raw tehina, made of 100% Ethiopian sesame seeds from a hard variety that is considered the highest quality thanks to the land where it grows.

The sesame is roasted and ground immediately after picking to preserve the nutritional values and prevent oxidation. From the millstones that grind the sesame, a flow of warm and fresh tahini falls directly into jars without human contact, and the resulting tehina is natural and pure and without preservatives or additives.

The secret to the taste of our tehina is in the quality of the sesame and the roasting temperature. Raw tehina is excellent for cooking and baking, as well as for making homemade tehina sauce, hummus salad, and halvah spread. It is very rich in protein, calcium, minerals and unsaturated fat, recommended for health and pleasant to the taste buds on the tongue.

380 grams per jar.

Kosher l'Mehadrin under the supervision of HaRav Landau of Bnei Brak

post_content: The Vacu Vin Lever Corkscrew is an elegant corkscrew for every occasion. It’s the wine bottle opener of choice for sommeliers and wine connoisseurs alike. The Lever Corkscrew has a specially designed horizontal frame for a firm grip with a gear and lever mechanism. After removing the wine bottle foil, open the lever and place the wine opener on the wine bottle by sliding the rubber grips over the neck. Firmly grip the arms to hold the Lever Corkscrew in place and fold the lever downwards to screw into the cork stopper. To remove the cork, move the lever upward. The Lever Corkscrew is easy to operate and requires little strength to open a bottle of wine without damaging the cork. The corkscrew's highly efficient system enables any wine cork – irrespective of length or material – to be extracted in a continuous, smooth, vertical motion.
post_excerpt: Elegant corkscrew for every occasion.

post_content: Meshek Achiya Picual Olive Oil is an excellent virgin olive oil characterized by a wonderful fruity aroma and fresh flavors of green olives, produced from the Picual variety grown in the Meshek Achiya groves. Picual oil has a delicate and unique herbaceous taste that adds a twist to every dish, a gentle bitterness and low acidity, which is why it is suitable for seasoning fresh salads, cheeses and Mediterranean dishes. The outstanding feature of Picual olive oil is its perfect compatibility for frying. The Picual variety contains a high percentage of antioxidants and oleic acid, and has a very low pyroxoid level. Thanks to these two advantages, it is resistant to decomposition in heat, which is why it is the most recommended for frying and cooking. The origin of the Picual olive is in Andalusia in Spain. It is considered of the highest quality due to its extremely low acidity and high stability, and its antioxidants keep you healthy. It is a particularly stable oil, which retains its taste and properties even during prolonged storage. Excellent virgin olive oil, maximum acidity up to 0.5%, without any additives and without preservatives. 1 Liter bottle. Certified kosher under the supervision of Rabanut Mate Binyamin - Heter Mechira
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Meshek-Achia-Picual-Olive-Oil-1000.png ! alt : Meshek Achia Picual Olive Oil ! title : Meshek Achia Picual Olive Oil 1000 ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Meshek Achiya Picual Olive Oil is virgin olive oil with a fruity aroma and fresh flavors of Picual green olives grown in the Meshek Achiya groves.

post_content: Meshek Achiya Syrian Olive Oil is an excellent choice for people who like authentic and strong olive oil. The oil is extracted from Syrian olives growing in the plantation of Ahya's farm in the Shiloh Valley, at an altitude of 750 meters above sea level. Syrian olive oil is the perfect match for hummus, white bread, salads and foods in which you want to feel the olive oil well. It is even suitable for desserts. The oil is also resistant to frying and is very suitable for baking and long-cooking foods, to which it contributes excellent aromas. The Syrian olive oil is rich in a green fruity aroma, it is endowed with dominant flavors of green apple and almonds and is considered to have moderate levels of pungency and bitterness. The oil is rich in phenols (natural flavors) and oleic acid, which makes it a healthy oil due to the fact that it contains a large amount of antioxidants. The Syrian variety, which comes from Tyre in Lebanon (and not from Syria, as many tend to think), has been growing in Israel for thousands of years. Apparently this is the oldest variety of olives in the world and the most common in Israel. Its resistance to dry climate conditions makes the Syrian variety particularly suitable for growing in the Middle East, and miraculously, and although it does not need a lot of water, it is among the group of varieties with the highest oil content in the fruit! The process of harvesting the olives begins at the beginning of October when half of the olives are still green. Like all the olive oils of Meshek Achiya, Syrian olive oil is also produced from olives that are carefully selected and become a pure oil in a cold pressing process that preserves its taste, aroma and natural color. Excellent virgin olive oil, maximum acidity up to 0.5%, without any additives and without preservatives. 1 Liter bottle. Certified kosher under the supervision of Rabanut Mate Binyamin - Heter Mechira
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Meshek-Achia-Syran-Olive-Oil-1000.png ! alt : Meshek Achiya Syrian Olive Oil ! title : Meshek Achiya Syrian Olive Oil ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Meshek Achiya Syrian Olive Oil is an excellent choice for people who like authentic and strong olive oil.

post_title: Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
post_content: Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon is an excellent example of the abilities of an old and experienced winery to get the best out of its area's vineyards. This is a powerful and explosive Cabernet Sauvignon with dark fruit flavors and high ripeness, full of layers of flavor. This wine is an intense and exciting experience. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2020 ABV: 15.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Golan Heights Grape(s): Cabernet Sauvignon Intensity (1-5): 5 Complexity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Recommended decanting - 60 minutes Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Tiveria, Rabanut Ramat Hagolan * Uncork with confidence. We taste each wine before ordering, so your always get wines of quality and value. Very High intensity (5 of 5) - Powerful and concentrated wine, boasting intense aromas and a rich, often complex palate. The wine experience is significant and commanding. They pair best with equally intense and flavorful dishes that can match their strength and complexity. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Yarden-Baron-Vineyard-Cabernet-Sauvignon-box-nv-1000.png ! alt : Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon ! title : Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon is powerful and explodes with dark fruit flavors, high ripeness, and full of layers of flavor.
meta:rank_math_focus_keyword: Golan Heights Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon

post_content: Mony Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is very different from its predecessor. It is a wine that arrives to leave an impression. It has a spicy herbaceous aroma and bold, impressive tastes of rich fruit, noticeable herbaceousness, and a spicy finish. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2022 ABV: 14.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Plains Grape(s): Cabernet Sauvignon Intensity (1-5): 4 Complexity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Badatz Beit Yosef, Badatz Mahzikei Hadat - Belz, Rabanut Mateh Yehuda * Sip assuredly. We personally taste each wine before it's offered, ensuring both quality and excellent value for you. High intensity (4 of 5) - High-intensity wines are bold and expressive, with pronounced aromas and concentrated flavors. They deliver a more impactful wine experience. These wines stand up well to richer, more flavorful foods, often cutting through richness or complementing strong spices. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.
post_excerpt: Bold and impressive with fruit, herbaceousness, and spice.

post_content: Tishbi Cabernet Onion Spread is created by Oshra Tishbi from the vintage of her family’s award-winning winery. The spread is a strikingly tasty combination of wine and onions that imparts a rich deep taste on breads and crackers, when cooked with meats, and other recipes. Prepared in small batches, the onions are slow-cooked to caramelize in the Cabernet Sauvignon, yielding concentrated and mildly sweet natural flavors. Add it to a cheese board for a dramatic taste experience. 220 grams
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Tishbi-Cabernet-Onion-Spread.png ! alt : Tishbi Cabernet Onion Spread ! title : Tishbi Cabernet Onion Spread ! desc :  ! caption :

post_content: Tishbi Strawberry Chardonnay Preserve can be used in any way that preserves are used and more. A creation of created Oshra Tishbi from the vintage of her family’s award-winning winery, these preserves are slow cooked to retain the fresh fruit flavor that melds beautifully with the Chardonnay. It is delicious as a spread on breads, and adds wonderful flavors to a cheese board, desserts, and when used in your favorite recipes. 220 grams

post_title: Galil Mountain Or Blanc de Noir
post_content: Galil Mountain Or Blanc de Noir is a refreshing white wine with the deep flavors of a red wine. Blanc de Nor refers to a white wine made from red grapes, from which the skins are separated after pressing. The result is a winning combination of color, aromas, and tastes. post_title: Adir Kerem Ben Zimra Chardonnay Orange
post_content: Adir Kerem Ben Zimra Chardonnay Orange is both deep and refreshing. Fermentation with the skins gives the wine its orange color and deeper red-wine taste profile, while retaining the refreshing sharpness of white wines. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 12.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Chardonnay Complexity (1-5): 3 Acidity (1-5): 3 Harmonize with: mild or rich flavors Contrast with: intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: Harav Mordecai Unger - Monsey, Badatz Beit Yosef, Rabanut Marom Hagalil * Sip assuredly. We personally taste each wine before it's offered, ensuring both quality and excellent value for you. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.

post_content:
Dreamy Indulgence in Every Sip

Embrace pure, decadent delight with Ilana's Liqueurs Ilanish Cream Liqueur (Dairy). This luxurious liqueur isn't just a drink, it's an experience - a creamy, smooth indulgence that melts on your tongue, leaving behind a symphony of rich flavors.

Imagine:

  • Velvety, smooth dairy cream infused with the subtle sweetness of vanilla and the warmth of spices, creating a dreamily comforting texture in every sip.
  • Hints of caramel and toffee add depth and complexity, making each sip a delectable discovery.
  • Enjoy it chilled, drizzled over desserts, or blended into milkshakes for a touch of creamy luxury.

Crafted with meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to using only the finest natural ingredients, Ilanish Cream Liqueur embodies the spirit of artisanal liqueur making. Whether you're seeking a unique after-dinner treat, a special ingredient for creative desserts, or simply a moment of pure indulgence, this liqueur is sure to impress.

Embark on a refreshing journey to sun-drenched Italian groves with Ilana's Liqueurs Limoncello Liqueur. This handcrafted delight captures the essence of ripe lemons, offering a vibrant burst of zesty sunshine in every sip.   • Infused with the delicate aroma of lemon zest, ensuring each sip is a delightful discovery of pure citrus essence.
  • Enjoy it neat, on the rocks, or add it to cocktails for a vibrant citrus twist that elevates any drink.

Crafted with meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to using only the finest natural ingredients, Ilana's Liqueurs Limoncello Liqueur embodies the spirit of artisanal liqueur making. post_content:
A Decadent Fusion for Coffee and Chocolate Lovers

Indulge in a delicious dance of flavors with Ilana's Liqueurs Chocolate Coffee Liqueur. This captivating blend seamlessly merges the richness of Belgian chocolate with the smooth warmth of espresso, creating a decadent experience for both coffee and chocolate connoisseurs.

Imagine:

  • Deep, luxurious chocolate notes intertwine with the bold richness of espresso, resulting in a layered and satisfyingly smooth flavor profile.
  • Hints of vanilla and caramel add a touch of sweetness and depth, enhancing the overall complexity.
  • Enjoy it neat, on the rocks, or as a decadent ingredient in creative cocktails. Its versatility makes it ideal for indulging in any way you desire.

Crafted with meticulous attention to detail and the finest natural ingredients, Ilana's Liqueurs Chocolate Coffee Liqueur embodies the spirit of artisanal liqueur making. Whether you're seeking a unique after-dinner treat, a luxurious addition to your coffee experience, or a flavorful base for creative cocktails, this liqueur is sure to tantalize your taste buds.
