post_content: Zion Capital Lions Gate White has intense tropical and citrus aromas and a lively taste with a noticeable acidity that continues the experience. It is an amazing wine for its price. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2024 ABV: 12.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Judean Hills Grape(s): Grenache, Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc Complexity (1-5): 3 Acidity (1-5): 4 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Badatz Eida Haredit Yerushalaim, Badatz Beit Yosef * Sip assuredly. We personally taste each wine before it's offered, ensuring both quality and excellent value for you. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. High acidity (4 of 5) - Expect a bright, tangy quality that makes feels fresh and lively. Acidity adds tartness, giving the wine a clean feel. With food, this crisp and zingy character can beautifully cut through richness and make flavors pop. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Rich flavors, extremely fresh, loaded with tropical and citrus aromas.

meta:rank_math_description: Zion Capital Lions Gate White is loaded with tropical and citrus aromas and continues to have a rich yet extremely fresh taste.

post_content: Golan Heights Gamla Chardonnay offers a barrel-aged Chardonnay experience with excellent value. It has noticeable depth and texture, accompanied by freshness and the characteristic aromas and flavors of Chardonnay. Dry White Wine Vintage: 2023 ABV: 13.5% Volume: 750 ML Region: Golan Heights Grape(s): Chardonnay Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 2 Harmonize with: mild or rich flavors Contrast with: intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Ramat Hagolan, Rabanut Tiveria * Quality and value, guaranteed. Before we order wines, we personally taste them to be sure you get the best selection. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Barrel-aged for noticeable depth and texture, with freshness.

post_content: Tura Mountain Heights Merlot shows us the qualities of this variety in this particular terrier very effectively. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. post_title: Cantina Giuliano Costa Toscana La Gioia
post_content: Cantina Giuliano Costa Toscana La Gioia is a wine designed to make the flavors of Tuscan wine accessible to the international palate. To this end, together with the delicate Sangiovese, they also combined Cabernet Sauvignon and a little Syrah in order to provide slightly richer flavors. The wonderful result is rich and balanced. post_content:
What wine to serve with cheese? Wines and cheeses vary quite a bit, but a few simple ideas can help make pairing easy.

Milder and lighter cheeses such as Mozzarella, Haloumi, or Gouda pair nicely with white and rosé wines that have lower acidity. The combination allows delicate wine flavors to harmonize with light cheese flavors. Wines with higher acidity might make an interesting counterpoint to these milder cheese flavors.

Strongly flavored cheeses (Brie, Camembert, and other rich, creamy soft cheeses) pair well with the sharper sensations of higher acidity wines. The acid of the wine and richness of the cheese bring fresh sensations in turn, each highlighting the other. Salty Feta, sharp Parmesan, tangy-creamy goat cheese, and buttery Havarti can also be good with high-acid white and rosé wines.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/cheese-please-02.jpg ! alt : cheese please wine and gourmet package ! title : cheese please ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:woosb_before_text: This package includes low, medium, and higher acid wines and some gourmet tastes to enjoy. You supply assorted cheeses, and some rustic bread. We hope you'll enjoy the experience thoroughly, and discover some favorite wine and cheese pairings.

post_title: Vacu Vin Wine Stoppers - Set of 2
post_content:
Vacu Vin Wine Stoppers are intended for use with the Vacu Vin Wine Saver, to store wine and prevent oxidizing that can harm the taste. Use these stoppers to keep wine fresh and tasty for up to ten days after opening. These stoppers are highly durable and made for prolonged use, encouraging more conscious enjoyment of wines, even after they've been opened. Insert the universal Vacuum Wine Stopper in your favorite bottle of wine. Use the Original Wine Saver to pump until you hear the patented “Click”. This signals that you have reached the optimum vacuum level, and have created an airtight seal. Your bottle is ready to be stored upright in the fridge, the countertop or a cabinet.
  • Preserve wine up until ten days
  • Compatible with all Vacu Vin Wine Savers
  • The Wine Stoppers are dishwasher friendly
  • The Wine Saver is suitable for all non-sparkling wines
  • The design is highly durable and will tolerate regular prolonged usage

post_content:
Negohot White Honey is from a rare spring flower, and is only available on rare occasions.

In the third year of the establishment of the apiary, it appeared for the first time: golden, buttery,  and with a wonderful taste. We enjoyed the honey immensely, but four years passed before the blossoms that are the basis of this honey appeared again.

We brought samples to the laboratory of Professor Dan Azikowitz, in an attempt to decipher the secret of the magic of the white and buttery honey that surprised us every few years. His reply: "This is the most delicious honey I've ever met, and I'm eighty years old!"

We still don't know as much as we wish about this amazing and rare honey, but we know enough to say it is a very special honey that you won't regret tasting while ti is available.

500 grams per jar.

Kosher l'Mehadrin for Passover and year-round under the supervision of Rabbi Moshe Cohen from Har Hebron.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/Negohot-White-Honey.png ! alt : Negohot White Honey ! title : Negohot White Honey ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:rank_math_description: Negohot White Honey is from a rare spring flower, and is only available on rare occasions. The buttery texture and wonderful taste are amazing.

post_content:
Meshek Achiya Picual Olive Oil is an excellent virgin olive oil characterized by a wonderful fruity aroma and fresh herbal flavors of green olives, produced from the Picual variety grown in the Meshek Achiya groves.

Picual oil has a delicate and unique herbaceous taste that adds a twist to every dish, a gentle bitterness and low acidity, which is why it is suitable for seasoning fresh salads, cheeses and Mediterranean dishes. The outstanding feature of Picual olive oil is its perfect compatibility for frying. The Picual variety contains a high percentage of antioxidants and oleic acid, and has a very low pyroxoid level. Thanks to these two advantages, it is resistant to decomposition in heat, which is why it is the most recommended for frying and cooking.

The origin of the Picual olive is in Andalusia in Spain. It is considered of the highest quality due to its extremely low acidity and high stability, and its antioxidants keep you healthy. It is a particularly stable oil, which retains its taste and properties even during prolonged storage.

Excellent virgin olive oil, maximum acidity up to 0.5%, without any additives and without preservatives. 100 ml

Certified kosher under the supervision of Rabanut Mate Binyamin

meta:rank_math_description: Meshek Achiya Picual Olive Oil has a fruity aroma and fresh herbal flavors. Produced from the Picual variety grown in the Meshek Achiya groves.

post_content: Meshek Achiya Koroneiki Olive Oil is an excellent virgin olive oil cherished by gourmets for its unique bold green aromas with the just-right level of bitterness and spiciness. This olive oil is especially suitable for salads and foods based on green vegetables, and for emphasizing the flavors of meat and fish with its deliciously robust flavor, and finishes with a pleasant, peppery zing. Koroneiki is the most common variety used for olive oil production in Greece (60% of the olive oil production). Characteristic aromas include artichoke, almond, tomato, and freshly-cut grass. post_content:
What wines with barbecue? Here is our package for a casual gathering of friends and family with flame-cooked foods.

People are often present before the food is ready, so we recommend having a cool refreshing wine on hand to greet the guests and inspire the chef. A light white can be just right while the coals get hot.

Nibbling is almost guaranteed, so try some amazing olive oil on your best sides and salads, and for dipping fresh bread. Any of the white remaining will be a nice lead-in with these foods, especially with popular Middle-Eastern dishes and senses heightened by the tempting cooking aromas.

The first red should be ready to pour about the time the food comes to the table. This milder red provides a pleasant transition and fits well with the smoky and savory foods coming off the grill.

This is where the serious eating often takes place, and the conversation gets a bit neglected while attention is on the plates and glasses. When the passing slows, and the mood mellows, pour the remaining red wine. This wine is more intense, so the tastes can come through the intense food flavors, and enhance the experience.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/al-ha-aish.jpg ! alt : BBQ (Al Ha-Esh) ! title : BBQ (Al Ha-Esh) ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:woosb_before_text: This package has something for everyone, makes hosting your own meal simple, and guarantees a great reception as a gift for your host when you travel. To serve the wines at their best, open the two reds and chilled white at around the same time, when you are ready to pour the first round. This will give the reds some time to 'breathe' and develop.

This package is here to eliminate the guesswork with one white and one red wine, each popular among a broad range of wine consumers. That doesn't mean that they are uninteresting, but that their unique characteristics are displayed in wines that have proven crowd appeal quality.

When the situation calls for versatile wine that can be enjoyed by just about anyone who likes a glass, this package is the low-risk/high-reward solution. Eliminate the stress and prevent awkward moments with wines that have been tasted and chosen for their quality, value, and power to please. Relax and enjoy this winning combination of wines with guests, hosts, family, and friends.

post_content:
What wines when you/they like dry reds? Go for something a little different to tickle your own palate and inspire others.

When you're looking for wines for people you know enjoy dry reds, we recommend trying some wines that offer rare experiences. There is no need to spend a fortune to bring the best classic aged Cabernet Sauvignon to someone who already has a wine refrigerator. You can offer a good quality alternative that stands out from the crowd.

The vineyards, grape varieties, and winemaking techniques in these wines each offer something special to share and savor with dry red wine fans. While we can't guarantee they will each become a new favorite, we're pretty sure you and your guests, hosts, family, and friends will find these wines worth a second sip, or more.

meta:woosb_before_text: To enhance the experience, we've included some tasty treats to enjoy. These wines are ready to enjoy about 30 minutes after opening, and we especially recommend tasting with fresh bread and the goodies in the package. Enjoy them as they are, or with a meal. Any way you like is the right way to appreciate this package.

post_content:
Which white wines are interesting? There are a lot of contenders in a short season, so this package has some very nice whites.

Fans of dry white wines can have a harder time discovering this season's gems. Red wines can be aged, then released and sold for several or many years. Most white wines are from the recent vintage, and may only be at their best for one season.

We've taken some of the guesswork out of dry white wines by tasting many, stocking some, and selecting a few shining examples for this package. These wines offer a tour of the range of grape varieties and wine styles to explore and enjoy.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/winning-whites.jpg ! alt : winning whites ! title : winning whites ! desc :  ! caption :
meta:woosb_before_text: The taste treats in this package are chosen to pair well with the wines and offer some emphasis, enhancement, and counterpoint to the nuanced flavors of the wines. Enjoy them on their own or as part of a meal. With this package, we hope to tempt even the red wine lovers to find favorite white wines.

What wines for Shabbat evening? Every Shabbat is a special time to relax and share with special people.

Make the wines and meal even better with wines that are great from Kiddush, through the meal, and dessert. Enjoy a milder tasty red to start the evening. The first wine is selected for a smoother and gentler start while things begin.

Pair the second, bolder red wine to the main course. The deeper flavors are ready to accompany the foods, echoing or highlighting the tastes. Sip a delicious dessert wine to finish the evening. The rich deep flavors are great with sweet desserts, tart apples, nuts, dark chocolate, and good company.

post_title: Flam Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve Double Magnum
post_content: Flam Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve Double Magnum 2021 vintage is slightly different from the winery's well-known Cabernet Sauvignon. The current vintage is exceptionally powerful, concentrated and intense. The lower air/wine ratio of the magnum format allows for longer aging, and adds festivity to a meal or celebration with many participants. post_content: The Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew is our twist on a classic wine accessory. The Twister has a spacer for extra stability and grip. After removing the foil from your bottle, place the corkscrew on top of the wine bottle. While maintaining a firm grip, press the sides against the bottle. The rubber strips make sure the bottle opener is secure and won’t turn while you drive the corkscrew into the cork. When the cork is extracted, remove the corkscrew from the bottle. You are ready to serve. The Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew extracts all wine corks (irrespective of length) in a continuous, smooth and vertical motion. The wired corkscrew easily slides into all corks, both synthetic and natural, making opening a wine bottle a quick and easy task. Its sleek and ergonomic design makes the Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew a household staple to open all corked wine bottles.
post_excerpt: Extra stability and comfort.
images: https://jlmwines.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Vacu-Vin-Twister-Corkscrew.jpg ! alt : Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew ! title : Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew ! desc :  ! caption : Accessories
meta:rank_math_description: The Vacu Vin Twister Corkscrew is our twist on a classic wine accessory. The Twister has a spacer for extra stability and grip.

post_content: Castel La Vie Rouge is a light and accessible version of the Castel winery known for the deep qualities of its wines. This red La Vie gives us fresh and balanced fruit aromas and flavors and is easy to drink and accordingly can accompany a variety of experiences. post_content: Golan Heights Yarden HeightsWine is an amazing example of meticulous work in the vineyard and winery. The Gewurztraminer clusters were harvested when very ripe, then frozen, and a very concentrated liquid extracted from them. The wine before us is rich and very concentrated in its flavors and sweetness. Dessert Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 12.5% Volume: 375 ML Region: Golan Heights Grape(s): Gewurztraminer Complexity (1-5): 4 Acidity (1-5): 2 Harmonize with: mild or sweet flavors Contrast with: intense flavors Kashrut: OK-P, Rabanut Tiveria, Rabanut Ramat Hagolan * Quality and value, guaranteed. Before we order wines, we personally taste them to be sure you get the best selection. High complexity (4 of 5) - High-complexity wines exhibit a wide array of aromas and flavors, often evolving in the glass. They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors.

post_content: Yatir Forest Magnum is the flagship wine that represents the highest quality vineyards of Yatir Winery. It represents the winery's best plots and their high qualities. The wine is powerful, rich and with an exceptionally long finish. The magnum format allows for longer aging and is excellent for large-scale events. Dry Red Wine Vintage: 2017 ABV: 14.5% Volume: 1500 ML Region: Negev Grape(s): Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc Intensity (1-5): 4 Complexity (1-5): 5 Harmonize with: rich or intense flavors Contrast with: mild flavors Recommended decanting - 60 minutes Kashrut: OK-P, Badatz Mehadrin - HaRav Rubin, Rabanut Israel * Taste the difference, confidently. By tasting wines ourselves before ordering, we ensure you only find quality and value here. High intensity (4 of 5) - High-intensity wines are bold and expressive, with pronounced aromas and concentrated flavors. They deliver a more impactful wine experience. These wines stand up well to richer, more flavorful foods, often cutting through richness or complementing strong spices. Very High complexity (5 of 5) - These wines are exceptionally complex, displaying a multitude of aromas and flavors that can be both primary (from the grape), secondary (from winemaking), and tertiary (from aging). The experience is profound and captivating, often revealing new dimensions with each sip. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce.
post_excerpt: Deep purple color, rich fragrance, and flavor that combines intensity with elegance and freshness.

post_content: Tishbi Katom is a really special wine. It has aromas of dried apricot, a little apple, with a touch of grassiness. Its taste is rich in apricot and berry flavors, with a really refined sweetness. Semi Dry Wine Vintage: 2021 ABV: 12.0% Volume: 750 ML Region: Galilee Grape(s): Riesling, Muscat Complexity (1-5): 3 Acidity (1-5): 2 Harmonize with: mild flavors Contrast with: rich, intense or sweet flavors Kashrut: OU-P, Badatz Beit Yosef - Not Mevushal, Rabbanut Zichron Yaakov * Embark on a flavorful journey. Every wine we offer is tasted by us first, guaranteeing quality and value. Moderate complexity (3 of 5) - Wines of moderate complexity show a noticeable interplay of several aromas and flavors, and perhaps a developing character on the palate. The experience is more engaging, with layers that unfold. Low acidity (2 of 5) - Lower acidity wines feel softer and rounder on the palate, lacking that sharp, tangy edge. They can feel smoother and sometimes richer. When paired with food, they tend to complement rather than contrast, often working well with richer, less acidic dishes. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Semi-dry with refined sweetness. Apricot & berry notes.

They offer a multi-layered and intriguing experience, with nuances that can be discovered over time. Moderate acidity (3 of 5) - Moderate acidity wines strike a balance, showing noticeable freshness without being overly tart. They feel lively but also have a certain smoothness. These wines are often very food-friendly and versatile. Harmonizing (congruent) pairings bring together wines and foods that share similar flavor components, creating a harmonious experience where the tastes reinforce each other. Harmonize with: • Mild flavors: Soft cheeses, white fish, lightly seasoned poultry, pasta in a light sauce. • Rich flavors: Salmon and similar fish, red meats, fattier foods, and many hard cheeses. Contrasting (complimentary) pairings bring together wines and foods with few shared flavor components. This creates a dynamic balance, where the different tastes complement and enhance each other. Contrast with: • Intense flavors: Heavily seasoned and spicy dishes, and foods with strong, more noticeable flavors. • Sweet flavors: Desserts and pastries, as well as foods prepared with sweet sauces, glazes, or sweet ingredients.
post_excerpt: Tropical aromas, rich taste, and fresh acidity.

post_content: Azeka Blend is a classic blend exhibiting the qualities of the Ella Valley and the effects of ageing on the wines. It has rich spicy aromas with a hint of sweetness in the background. Its flavors are rich and well integrated giving us a rich and simultaneously gentle experience. It may have some sediment, that is a sign that it wasn't filtered and that the wine is ageing healthily.
